intro: Diotocarpus prunelloides, commonly known as the purple-leafed diotocarpus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its striking purple foliage and small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
